intro: Muellera grazielae, commonly known as the Grazielae muellera, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
